intro: Cruciata articulata, commonly known as the articulated crucifix, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Cruciata articulata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
